授業目的: The objective of this course is for the students to understand how research is conducted in business organizations. This course benefits the students in two ways: (1) it helps the students to conduct their Independent Research Project, and (2) it also enables the students to conduct research in real life business setting to solve related managerial problems.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of the requirements for this course, students will be able to:
a) understand and critically evaluate relevant academic and research literature;
b) develop data acquisition and management skills for research;
c) Evaluate the alternative research methods (qualitative, quantitative or mixed method) for their research;
d) develop, structure and present a research proposal; and
e) carry out a basic research project independently.
授業の概要・背景: In this course, students will get a complete outline of the research process including discussion on research problem, literature review, research design, hypothesis development, variable measurement, data collection, data analysis and presentation of both qualitative and quantitative data.
授業方法:
All lectures will be conducted in Hy-Flex. The online class is mainly intended for international students who are unable to enter Japan due to immigration restrictions related to COVID-19, etc., and for whom the IBA has permitted to take classes online. For online students, classes will be held at the time specified in the timetable via interactive live streaming using Zoom.
Study materials (i.e., PowerPoint slides, exercises, and home assignments) will be uploaded to LUNA one week in advance. Students are strongly encouraged to read the materials before joining the class. It would be helpful to note down the key concepts in each chapter to discuss in class.
Teaching methods include class lectures, students’ debates in class discussions, assignments, and final reports.
Class lecture: In each class, the instructor will open the discussion on a particular topic by clarifying the key concepts and theories. All students are expected to be prepared for class and actively participate and contribute to classroom discussions.
Review of academic paper: Each student is required to choose a published paper based on his/her interest in any academic journal and write a formal review of the article. The review should start by asking the questions like: Why is the article important? What is the research question? and What is the author’s motivation to write the paper? Subsequently, students should also comment on other issues of the paper including research design, theoretical framework, hypothesis development, key findings, and contribution to literature and practice. You need to choose the paper within the first two weeks of the semester. A standard review should be 3 pages on A4 size paper.
Final report: Final report consists of the submission of a formal research proposal.
